address.addrLine: To The Revd Mr Brown, President of Pembroke Hall Cambridge

body.p: I have received a letter from Howe, another from Mr Beattie, & a third, wch was a printed Catalogue, from London. the parcel sent to Cambridge was a set of Algarotti's works for your Library, wch need not be impatient, if it remain unopen'd, till I come. the Doctor & I came hither on Saturday last: he return'd on Wednesday, & I set out for London (pray for me!) at ten o'clock tomorrow night. you will please to direct to me at Roberts's, as usual, & when it is convenient I shall be glad of my Bill. I will trouble you also to give notice of my motions to Miss Antrobus, as soon as you can.

Here has been Ld Holdernesse's ugly face, since I was here, & here actually is Mr Weddell, who enquires after you. Pa: is in London with his Brother, who is desperate: if he dies, We shall not be a shilling the better, so we are really very sorrowful. Mason desires his love to you.

closer.salute:
Adieu! the Minster-bell rings! I am ever
Yours

postscript.p: I rejoice greatly at N:'s good luck.
